newsitem.title: USA: Occidental Petroleum net hit by oil price drop.
newsitem.headline: Occidental Petroleum net hit by oil price drop.

text.p: Occidental Petroleum Corp. said its net income fell 13 percent in the second quarter, hurt by lower natural gas and crude oil prices.
The Los Angeles-based oil and gas company said its earnings dropped to $158 million in the period, or 41 cents a share, compared with $181 million, or 49 cents a share a year ago.

The drop in earnings, which was in line with Wall Street estimates, was partially offset by increased gas production and lower exploration expenses, the company said. Net favourable charges of $55 million also cushioned the earnings decline.
Second-quarter sales rose to $2.7 billion from $2.5 billion a year ago.
Crude oil prices have fallen sharply from a year ago, when concerns about low inventories sparked a worldwide rally in prices.
Occidental rose 28 cents a share to $24.28 on the New York Stock Exchange in afternoon trading.
